snippet: Evidence presented to a panel investigating the police shooting of striking platinum miners in Marikana in August strongly suggests that weapons were placed next to the bodies of dead miners, lawyers representing victims’ families said.
abstract: Photo and video evidence presented to commission investigating police shooting in Marikana, South Africa, which left 34 striking miners dead, suggests that weapons were placed next to bodies of dead miners, in attempt to make it appear that police had no choice but to fire on them.
lead_paragraph: Evidence presented to a panel investigating the police shooting of striking platinum miners in Marikana in August strongly suggests that weapons were placed next to the bodies of dead miners, lawyers representing victims’ families said.
